headers: FUNDRAISING ARCHITECTURE — TWO RAISES, ONE SYSTEM

rows.FUNDRAISING ARCHITECTURE — TWO RAISES, O: RAISE 1: IonWave (The Spinoff)
What: Seed round for a D2C electrolyte brand.
How much: $150-500K (standard D2C seed).
From whom: Angels, micro-VCs, D2C-focused investors.
Pitch: 'Funded company with 698-tab operating system, expert-validated across 7 domains.
5 companies launched using this system. CEO walks into a pre-built machine.'
Use of funds: Inventory, ad spend, team, initial operating costs.
When: Weeks 3-8 of sprint (CoS runs this as their primary project).
This is a normal startup raise. The only unusual thing is the level of preparation.
RAISE 2: Coordination Hedgefund (The Infrastructure Company)
What: Seed/Pre-seed for an AI company that automates business launches.
How much: $1-3M (AI company seed).
From whom: AI-focused VCs, infrastructure investors, crypto-adjacent funds that understand DAO thesis.
Pitch: 'We've built the execution layer for business theses. Thesis → Trade → Execution.
IonWave is proof. 5 companies funded. 698-tab system. Now we're building the tech
to automate it: Trade Automation (P1), RL Environment (P2), Trade Parameterization (P3).
Each spinoff generates training data. The system gets smarter with every company launched.
We're building the operating system for launching businesses.'
Use of funds: Engineering team for P1/P2/P3. Second and third spinoffs. Infrastructure.
When: Months 2-6 (after IonWave is live and generating proof).
This is a tech raise disguised as a venture studio raise.
The key insight for investors: this isn't a 'fund that launches companies.'
It's a tech company where each company launched is training data for the automation system.
The moat deepens with every Trade completed.
SEQUENCING
Raise 1 happens FIRST because it's easier and proves the system.
Raise 2 uses Raise 1 results as proof.
Week 1-3: Sprint. VA, CoS, Product Person, sites live.
Week 3-8: IonWave raise (CoS leads, using Trade + sites as pitch materials).
Month 2-3: IonWave generating revenue. Proof accumulating.
Month 3-6: Infrastructure company raise (Nilo leads, using IonWave as case study).
Month 6+: Engineering team building P1. Second spinoff in pipeline.
IonWave success de-risks the infrastructure raise.
The infrastructure raise funds the tech that makes future IonWaves cheaper and faster.
Each spinoff generates training data that makes the next one more automated.
The flywheel is: companies launched → data generated → system improves → cheaper to launch → more companies launched.
WHAT THE DAO STRUCTURE ACTUALLY MEANS
Not token-based. Not voting tokens. Not DeFi.
The DAO structure means:
• Transparent governance. Everyone can see the treasury, the progress, the grading.
• Equity participation. Everyone in the chain gets equity in what they help build.
• Executable documentation. The Trade IS the DAO's operating logic — not smart contracts,
but documented processes with verification and grading.
• Public accountability. The IonWave spinoff page shows progress in real time.
The VA updates daily. The milestones are visible. The grades are transparent.
This is a DAO in the structural sense (decentralized, transparent, participatory)
without the token speculation that killed most DAOs.
The 'token' is equity. The 'smart contract' is the Trade. The 'governance' is the CM system.
The specific legal and equity structure doesn't need to be determined now.
What needs to be true: every participant gets a piece of what they help build,
and the system is transparent enough that everyone can verify progress.
